title: How to Make Kawaii Mushrooms

steps.headline: Gather your supplies.
steps.description: Begin by getting everything you need. Just about everything can be obtained from your local craft store. In addition to what's shown below you'll also need a little bit of stuffing which is usually sold in large quantities.

steps.headline: Check your measurements.
steps.description: You'll need to make sure everything's the right side or else you'll have a quite crooked mushroom.

steps.headline: Sew the white fabrics for the base of your mushroom together.
steps.description: You can leave a small opening and then sew that after adding the stuffing.

steps.headline: Sew the two pieces together.
steps.description: To do this you'll need to use a pin to hold the top and bottom together while you sew around the edges in a circular shape.

steps.headline: Sew the edges on the mushroom topper.
steps.description: The brown circle will later be sewn around the top however for now you will need to sew a circle around the edges. This will be a great guide for the next step.

steps.headline: Pinch sides and sew so it ends up in somewhat of a 'bowl' shape.
steps.description: It doesn't have to completely fit the top of your mushroom.

steps.headline: Put the topper own and sew around the edges.
steps.description: Remember, this will be your final product so be clean with it.

steps.headline: You're finished!
steps.description: You can decorate from here, use a mini-tip felt pen an add a face from here or leave it plain and cute as-is.

text: Gather your supplies. Begin by getting everything you need. Just about everything can be obtained from your local craft store. In addition to what's shown below you'll also need a little bit of stuffing which is usually sold in large quantities. Check your measurements. You'll need to make sure everything's the right side or else you'll have a quite crooked mushroom. Sew the white fabrics for the base of your mushroom together. You can leave a small opening and then sew that after adding the stuffing. Sew the two pieces together. To do this you'll need to use a pin to hold the top and bottom together while you sew around the edges in a circular shape. Sew the edges on the mushroom topper. The brown circle will later be sewn around the top however for now you will need to sew a circle around the edges. This will be a great guide for the next step. Pinch sides and sew so it ends up in somewhat of a 'bowl' shape. It doesn't have to completely fit the top of your mushroom. Put the topper own and sew around the edges. Remember, this will be your final product so be clean with it. You're finished! You can decorate from here, use a mini-tip felt pen an add a face from here or leave it plain and cute as-is.
